title: What are the hot topics for research in electronics? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many different areas in electronics such as Microwave and Communication systemsControl SystemsSensing Imaging and Signal ProcessingPower SystemsPower ConversionMicroelectronics and Nanostructure etc.Each of this is a vast area. A large number of research topics could be possible under each of these areas such as Co-design methodologies for embedded systems, thermal modeling for MPSoC and 3D-integration architectures, memory system optimizations, software mapping techniques. Multimedia signal processing, image processing, image compression, video processing, video compression, media security. Interdisciplinary topics related to EM micro/millimeter waves: dynamic reconfiguration, micro/nanotechnology, joint antenna-coding techniques, metamaterial. Computational electromagnetics; design, analysis and characterization of passive microwave and mm-wave circuits, antennas and wireless sensors, antennas for biomedical applications. Acoustic expertise; active Control; acoustic antennae; sound design. Speech processing, computer vision, information retrieval, biometric authentication, multimodal interaction and machine learning. Signal processing theory, information theory, compressive sensing, graphical models, statistical signal processing. Optical informationsystems including memories, computers, sensors, and communications. Optofluidics; femtosecond nonlinear otpics; holography Mathematical signal and image processing, high-dimensional data processing, sparsity in signal processing, inverse problems. Multimedia communications, multimedia signal processing, image and video coding, image analysis. Image segmentation, PDE's, model-based image anaylsis, registration, medical imaging, multimodal signal/image analysis. Photonics, fiber-optics, lightwave communication, all-optical signal processing, nonlinear optics, parametric processes, four-wave mixing, multicasting, microstructured fiber, waveguides. Circuits and Systems for Telecommunication : energy efficient and reliable signal processing and VLSI circuits for wireless and wireline communications. Biosensors, integrated systems, miniaturized detection of biomolecules, electrical-based interactions with living matter, high-throughput systems. Radio Frequency Integrated Circuits, Wireless Data Communications for sensor nodes (e.g. biomedical, environmental applications), Remotely Powered Electronic Circuits, Radio Frequency Identification Systems (RFID), Micro Power Analog Integrated Circuits, Electrical Analog Filters. Analog and mixed-signal IC design, sensors interface and signal processing, analog VLSI, analog CAD tools. Nanoelectronic devices : electronic properties of nanoscale structures; device and circuit design, fabrication and modeling; integration. Optcal microcavities; cavity optomechanics; monolithic frequency comb generation; dispersive molecule detection, quantum measurements. Hardware and software design for traditional (computation on silicon) and non-traditional (nanotechnology and biosensors) systems. High-performance digital and mixed-signal VLSI circuits, language-based modeling and validation of SoC components, intelligent system architectures. Smart grids, Microgrids, Distributed monitoring systems, Phasor measurement units, Real-time optimal operation of distribution networks, Fault location, Distributed generation, Storage systems, Power quality, Insulation coordination.Industrial Electronics, modeling and applied control; Power electronics, with the development of new converter structures or topologies; Energy conversion, including management and storageElectrical energy generation, conversion, storage; Medium voltage applications; High power electronic converters, modelling, simulation, design, optimization, control, power semiconductors, advanced magnetics; Highperformance variable speed drivesModelling and optimization of middle-sized and large electrical machines, analysis and simulation of electrical power systems and adjustable speed drivesElectromagnetic Compatibility, Lightning Discharge, Modeling, Simulation Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things and more

VLSI might have been become ULSI or XLSI (Extreme large scale integration) and will continue to be hot topics as demands of smaller electronics is on rise.12. Optical Circuits13. It involves making production of electronics components hazard free and safe to human health involves in the production and repair. Green electronics may cover some of its parts.

I find this question hard to answer, because the field is too wide and the term electronics is not well enough defined. Many of the things mentioned by other commenters are more material science with applications in electronics, or optical sciences and a lot of energy is going into making machines smarter, which is strictly speaking a matter of computer science. I can't say, what is hot, because I am not too involved in the field, but what you are probably looking for is anything involving power distribution and management, system-on-a-chip, man-machine interfaces (multidisciplinary), sensor networks and embedded systems.

Electronics is such a huge field that is not easy to answer.But the two largest trends are smaller and faster circuits.The former is hitting the wall of circuit features spanning individual atoms. The latter is hitting the wall of gates that never actually get to change state. Those are the hardest problems in pure electronics. Then, you have the problem of heat dissipation at such small scales, the problem of exploding complexity, and the problem of power consumption.A bit outside the scope is the problem of energy storage and energy harvesting, so you can have devices that stay in the field for months or years without a need to recharge.
